result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with victim's family, MG, JG, CC, TD, SD or ND.
Any treatment or counseling for mental health as ordered by DOC.   Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Re-Entered Order Denying Motion for Amended Postconviction Relief

IT IS ORDERED that the record is remanded to the circuit court for re-entry of the order denying the amended postconviction motion.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the record shall be returned to this court within twenty-one days of the date of this order and shall include the re-entered order.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the respondent's brief shall be due within fourteen days of the return of the record to this court following remand.
